title: Adrift Field Methods
text: This document provides information related to fieldwork for ADRIFT in the California Current, which uses drifting acoustic recorders to monitor marinea mammals and the ocean soundscape. These methods include hardware specifications and assembly, preparing for deployment, deployment methods, tracking methods, and retrieval methods.

title: Field Retrieval
text:
Edit the qmd or md files in the content folder. qmd files can include code (R, Python, Julia) and lots of Quarto markdown bells and whistles (like call-outs, cross-references, auto-citations and much more).
Each page should start with

and the first header will be the 2nd level, so ##. Note, there are situations where you leave off

and start the qmd file with a level header #, but if using the default title yaml (in the --- fence) is a good habit since it makes it easy for Quarto convert your qmd file to other formats (like into a presentation).

title: Hardware- Pole Buoy
text:
The purpose of the pole buoy is to help track, find, and support the drifting recorder. The pole buoy consists of;

Weighted pole
Floats
Bridle
Radar reflector
GPS mount




Diagram of High Flyer Pole Buoy
